conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls have height/thickness, multiple faces are visible, interior volume reads as rooms, and the view is angled with the ceiling/roof removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable corners and clear floor/wall separation; minor simplification in some junctions and opening detailing.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall apartment massing and the 3-bedroom + central living/dining concept matches, and balconies appear on the right; however several plan spaces are missing or merged (deck not represented, kitchen/utility not clearly modeled, toilet count reduced vs plan) and some internal partitions do not align cleanly with the 2D arrangement.

interior_elements.notes: Bedrooms and living/dining furniture are present and plausibly scaled; bathrooms are simplified and fewer; kitchen fixtures/counters are largely absent or not identifiable relative to the 2D plan.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean cutaway presentation with good readability; openings/windows are visible but not fully verifiable against the 2D; lighting is adequate and no obvious broken meshes.

detected_errors.description: Major spaces from the 2D plan are missing or not clearly represented in 3D (deck; kitchen/utility not clearly modeled; toilet count reduced compared with plan).
Internal partition layout and adjacency relationships appear simplified/shifted relative to the 2D plan (service core and bathroom cluster do not match well).
Door/window placement and sizing cannot be confirmed to match the 2D plan; several openings appear generic rather than plan-faithful.

summary: This is a genuine 3D cutaway conversion, but it simplifies the plan significantly and omits/merges several key rooms and service spaces, reducing layout fidelity.
